intro: Picramnia triandra, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland and savanna habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated in horticulture.
